page.title: 16HASELEY KNOB: TRAFFIC CENSUS
page.content:
The{A41}runs from{London}to{Birmingham and is therefore one of the most major roads in England. It is the most important road in this area. Here is a record of the traffic passing along it near the{Five Ways}roundabout at Haseley,during a typical 15-minute period on a week-day:-
|To B'ham |From B'ham|Total Cars | 46 | { }91 | 137 Lorries | {5 }| {13 }| {18 Vans | { }3 | { }13 | 16 'Buses | {0 }| {0 }| {0 Bicyles | 0 | { }1 |{ }1 Motorbikes | {1 }| {1 }| {2 Caravans | { }0 | { }1 |{ }1 Total | {55 }| {120 }|{175
{ { THIS REPRESENTS AN AVERAGE OF}700 { VEHICLES PER HOUR USING THE ROAD.
